item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>It's certainly true that you need to look at the screen to control it, so if you use your iPod while driving I wouldn't recommend the touch. But I don't and I'm still in the honeymoon period. We'll see how I fare over the next couple of weeks.</p>
item.content:encoded: It’s certainly true that you need to look at the screen to control it, so if you use your iPod while driving I wouldn’t recommend the touch. But I don’t and I’m still in the honeymoon period. We’ll see how I fare over the next couple of weeks.

item.title: By: Kevin Pettitt
item.dc:creator: Kevin Pettitt
item.description: <p>I'm almost ashamed to admin I have never owned an Ipod (although I did present my wife a pink Mini a few Valentine's Days ago). That said, I know enough to be afraid of a purely touchscreen gadget that does things that shouldn't require your eyes to be open.<br /><br />And I'm not the only one: { <a href="<a rel="nofollow" href="http://www.greyhawk68.com/greyhawk68/home.nsf/d6plinks/GREK-77LGCQ"" rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.greyhawk68.com/greyhawk68/home.nsf/d6plinks/GREK-77LGCQ"</a> rel="nofollow" target ="blank">Link</a> }<br /><br />I'd be interested to get your take on that issue.</p>
item.content:encoded:
I’m almost ashamed to admin I have never owned an Ipod (although I did present my wife a pink Mini a few Valentine’s Days ago). That said, I know enough to be afraid of a purely touchscreen gadget that does things that shouldn’t require your eyes to be open.

And I’m not the only one: { http://www.greyhawk68.com/greyhawk68/home.nsf/d6plinks/GREK-77LGCQ“ rel=”nofollow” target =”blank”>Link }

I’d be interested to get your take on that issue.
